doss

Interface BlobTx

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Named, Transaction
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LocalBlobStore.Tx

    public interface BlobTx
extends Named, Transaction
    A transaction for writing to a BlobStore.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes the transaction handle and releases resources.
      void commit()
      Commits the transaction, ensuring all blobs written in this transaction are persisted in permanent storage.
      void prepare()
      Ensure all data has hit disk and the transaction can be committed without error.
      Blob put(byte[] bytes)
      Store the contents of a byte array as a new blob.
      Blob put(Path source)
      Store a local file as a new blob.
      Blob put(Writable output)
      Store a new blob.
      void rollback()
      Rolls back transaction, purging any newly written objects.

      • Methods inherited from interface doss.core.Named

      • prepare

        void prepare()
             throws IllegalStateException,
                    IOException
        Ensure all data has hit disk and the transaction can be committed without error. Used in two-phase commit. Note: Once a transaction has been prepared it will not automatically be committed or rolled-back. It MUST be explicitly rolled-back or committed. Applications can recover lost transactions using BlobStore.recover()
        Specified by:
        prepare in interface Transaction
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        IllegalStateException

      • close

        void close()
           throws IllegalStateException,
                  IOException
        Closes the transaction handle and releases resources. Normal operation does not alter the transaction state, but see below for exceptions. This method should only be called after calling prepare(), commit() or rollback(). If this method is called while the transaction is in any other state, then an IllegalStateException will be thrown and the transaction will be rolled back. Implementors should look at ManagedTransaction for how to get this behaviour.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface Transaction
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If called while the transaction is not in a valid state to be closed. The transaction will be automatically rolled back when this exception is thrown.
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
